label: 藤原忠平
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Fujiwara no Tadahira (J.) 藤原忠平, sometimes called 小一条太政大臣 Koichijō daijō daijin; posthumous name 貞信公 Teishinkō and,later, 信濃公 Shinanokō. This powerful aristocrat became head of the northern Fujiwarars after the death of his elder brother Tokihira (871-909), and rose to be regent, prime minister, then chancellor during the reign of emperor Suzaku (r. 930-46), dying in 949. He also completed the compilation of the court ritual text Engishiki after the death of Tokihira and wrote works such as the diary Teishinkō ki.
